襚字的基本解释

襚
suì
赠给死者衣物：“楚人使公亲襚。”
指向活人赠送衣物。
古代贯穿佩玉的丝织绶带。

襚字的汉语字典释义

[①]［suì］
［《廣韻》徐醉切，去至，邪。］
(1)古吊丧之礼。向死者赠送衣衾等。停柩前吊丧者为死者穿衣；或停柩后将送死者之衣置于柩东，皆谓之“襚”。
(2)指赠送给死者的车马、衣衾等物。
(3)泛指赠送生人的衣物。
(4)即绶带。
(5)古代用以对丝的计量。两緵为一襚。
(6)用同“旞”。以五彩鸟羽为饰的旗。

襚字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　襚； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1125第24
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?徐醉切，音遂。【說文】衣死人也。【白虎通】襚之爲言遺也。【禮·少儀】敵者曰襚。【疏】襚者，以衣送死人之稱，禮以衣送敵者死曰襚。襚者，遂彼生時之意也。【周禮·天官】荒喪受其含襚幣玉之事。　又【西京雜記】趙飛燕女弟遺書曰：謹上襚三十五條，以陳踴躍之心。按此則襚不獨助死之禮。　【集韻】或作?。

graveclothes
Basic explanation of words
graveclothes
suì
Give clothes to the deceased: "Chu people make friends with their fathers."
Point to the living person to give away clothes.
The silk ribbon that runs through the jade in ancient times.
graveclothes
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［suì］
["Guang Yun" Xu Zui cut, go to the end, evil. ]
(1) Ancient funeral ceremonies. Gift clothing to the deceased, etc. The person who hangs the funeral dresses the deceased before stopping; or places the clothes for the deceased in the east after stopping, which is called "Xiao".
(2) Refers to carts, horses, clothing, etc. presented to the deceased.
(3) Generally refers to the gift of clothes to strangers.
(4) That is ribbon.
(5) It was used to measure silk in ancient times. Two pieces are one piece.
(6) Use the same as "旞". A flag decorated with colorful bird feathers.
graveclothes
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Jixia] [Department of Clothing Characters] 　襚; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 1125 Page 24
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Xu Zui cut, and the sound is complete. [Said the text] The clothes are dead. 【Baihutong】Xi Zhi is a last word. [Li·Shaoyi] The enemy said Xi. 【Sparse】The nicked person is called nicknamed to give away the dead with clothes. The person who is ridiculous is the meaning of the time of his life. [Zhou Li·Tian Guan] The famine and funeral were affected by the fact that he contained coins and jade.　[Xijing Miscellaneous Notes] Zhao Feiyan’s daughter’s brother's suicide note said: I would like to add thirty-five articles to Chen's enthusiastic heart. According to this, Xi is not the only gift to help death.　【Jiyun】or make?.

Old glyph
graveclothes
Name meaning
Nothing.
suì
(1) 古吊丧之礼。 为死者穿衣 put on shroud for a dead person
(2) 又如: 亲襚(亲手给死者穿衣); 襚敛(给死者穿衣入棺)
(3) 向死者赠衣被 persent dress and quilt to a dead person
(4) 又如: 襚礼(吊丧者赠送死者的衣衾等物); 向襚(向死者赠衣被); 襚衣(襚服。 赠送给死者的衣服)
(5) 赠活人衣服 present dress
